gen:link.msg:message: Reported values for alternative tagging of same economic concept are not equal
Reported value exceeds 0
Reported value exceeds 0

percentGreaterThan100: According to the Guidance 2.2.2 of ESEF Reporting Manual, it is recommended to present rates, percentages and ratios in decimal notation. The reported value exceeds 100%. Please make sure that the value is tagged following the correct notation.
Reported value is below 0
Duplicated facts with different values have been reported for: {node-name($v1)}, value:{$v1} != {$v2} please review selected entries.

According to the IAS 1, comparative information must be disclosed in respect of the previous period for all amounts reported in the financial statements, both on the face of the financial statements and in the notes, unless another standard requires otherwise. Please make sure that XBRL context period end date is provided with at least two unique date values.

According to the IAS 1, comparative information must be disclosed in respect of the previous period for all amounts reported in the financial statements, both on the face of the financial statements and in the notes, unless another standard requires otherwise. Please make sure that XBRL context instant period is provided with at least two unique date values.

invalidIdentifierFormat: According to the Regulatory Technical Standards on European Single Electronic Format, all issuers shall identify themselves using ISO 17442 legal entity identifiers on the XBRL context entity identifiers and schemes. Please make sure all XBRL context entity identifier schemes are provided with the value "http://standards.iso.org/iso/17442".

multipleIdentifiers: According to the Regulatory Technical Standards on European Single Electronic Format, all issuers shall ensure that the Inline XBRL instance document contains data of a single issuer. Therefore all entity identifiers in contexts shall have identical content. Please make sure all XBRL context entity identifiers are provided with the identical value.

periodWithTimeContent: According to the Guidance 2.1.2 of ESEF Reporting Manual, it is recommended to present the period element in the YYYY-MM-DD format without the time component. Please make sure that XBRL context period end date is provided with a date value following the recommended format.

periodWithTimeContent: According to the Guidance 2.1.2 of ESEF Reporting Manual, it is recommended to present the period element in the YYYY-MM-DD format without the time component. Please make sure that XBRL context period start date is provided with a date value following the recommended format.

periodWithTimeContent: According to the Guidance 2.1.2 of ESEF Reporting Manual, it is recommended to present the period element in the YYYY-MM-DD format without the time component. Please make sure that XBRL context instant period is provided with a date value following the recommended format.

segmentUsed: According to the Guidance 2.1.3 of ESEF Reporting Manual, it is recommended to use only scenario container in context elements of XBRL instance document. Please make sure that segment container is not used in any of the XBRL contexts.

htmlOrXmlBaseUsed: According to the Guidance 2.4.1 of ESEF Reporting Manual, it is recommended to not use xml:base attribute in a report. Please make sure that @xml:base attribute is not present in XBRL report.

nonStandardRoleForFootnote: According to the Guidance 2.3.1 of ESEF Reporting Manual, it is recommended to use standard XBRL 2.1 roles and arcroles while defining footnotes in a report. Please make sure that @xbrl:arcrole attribute on each footnoteArc element is populated with "http://www.xbrl.org/2003/arcrole/fact-footnote" value.

nonStandardRoleForFootnote: According to the Guidance 2.3.1 of ESEF Reporting Manual, it is recommended to use standard XBRL 2.1 roles and arcroles while defining footnotes in a report. Please make sure that @xbrl:role attribute on each footnote element is populated with "http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/footnote" value.

nonStandardRoleForFootnote: According to the Guidance 2.3.1 of ESEF Reporting Manual, it is recommended to use standard XBRL 2.1 roles and arcroles while defining footnotes in a report. Please make sure that @xbrl:role attribute on each footnoteLink element is populated with "http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/link" value.

nonStandardContentForFootnote: According to the Guidance 2.3.1 of ESEF Reporting Manual, it is recommended that footnoteLink element has no children other than link:loc, link:footnote and link:footnoteArc. Please make sure that link:documentation element is not used for any of the footnoteLink elements present in XBRL report.

unusedFootnote: According to the Guidance 2.3.1 of ESEF Reporting Manual, it is recommended that footnote element must be linked to at least one fact. Please make sure that all footnotes are linked to at least one fact in XBRL report with use of link:footnoteArc element.

fractionElementUsed: According to the Guidance 2.4.1 of ESEF Reporting Manual, it is recommended to not use fraction items in a report. Please make sure that no fact with fractionItemType or with type derived from fractionItemType is present in XBRL report.

precisionAttributeUsed: According to the Guidance 2.2.1 of ESEF Reporting Manual and Section 2.8.11 of Financial Reporting Instance Standards 1.0, it is recommended to use @decimals attribute rather than the @precision attribute on numeric facts to define their accuracy. Please make sure that @precision attribute is not used on any of the numeric facts in the XBRL instance document.

undefinedLanguageForTextFact: According to the Guidance 2.5.2 of ESEF Reporting Manual, it is recommended that a language attribute is assigned to all textual facts. Please make sure that xml:lang attribute is inherited or assigned to each textual fact.
tupleElementUsed: According to the Guidance 2.4.1 of ESEF Reporting Manual, it is recommended to not use tuples in a report. Please make sure that tuple element is not present in XBRL report.

missingMandatoryMarkups: According to the Regulatory Technical Standards on European Single Electronic Format, the element "Address of entity's registered office" is part of the mandatory list of tags that must be applied if corresponding information is present in a report. Please make sure that you applied this tag in your report.

missingMandatoryMarkups: According to the Regulatory Technical Standards on European Single Electronic Format, the element "Country of incorporation" is part of the mandatory list of tags that must be applied if corresponding information is present in a report. Please make sure that you applied this tag in your report.

missingMandatoryMarkups: According to the Regulatory Technical Standards on European Single Electronic Format, the element "Description of nature of entity's operations and principal activities" is part of the mandatory list of tags that must be applied if corresponding information is present in a report. Please make sure that you applied this tag in your report.

missingMandatoryMarkups: According to the Regulatory Technical Standards on European Single Electronic Format, the element "Domicile of entity" is part of the mandatory list of tags that must be applied if corresponding information is present in a report. Please make sure that you applied this tag in your report.

missingMandatoryMarkups: According to the Regulatory Technical Standards on European Single Electronic Format, the element "Explanation of change in name of reporting entity or other means of identification from end of preceding reporting period" is part of the mandatory list of tags that must be applied if corresponding information is present in a report. Please make sure that you applied this tag in your report.

missingMandatoryMarkups: According to the Regulatory Technical Standards on European Single Electronic Format, the element "Legal form of entity" is part of the mandatory list of tags that must be applied if corresponding information is present in a report. Please make sure that you applied this tag in your report.

missingMandatoryMarkups: According to the Regulatory Technical Standards on European Single Electronic Format, the element "Name of parent entity" is part of the mandatory list of tags that must be applied if corresponding information is present in a report. Please make sure that you applied this tag in your report.

missingMandatoryMarkups: According to the Regulatory Technical Standards on European Single Electronic Format, the element "Name of reporting entity or other means of identification" is part of the mandatory list of tags that must be applied if corresponding information is present in a report. Please make sure that you applied this tag in your report.

missingMandatoryMarkups: According to the Regulatory Technical Standards on European Single Electronic Format, the element "Name of ultimate parent of group" is part of the mandatory list of tags that must be applied if corresponding information is present in a report. Please make sure that you applied this tag in your report.

missingMandatoryMarkups: According to the Regulatory Technical Standards on European Single Electronic Format, the element "Principal place of business" is part of the mandatory list of tags that must be applied if corresponding information is present in a report. Please make sure that you applied this tag in your report.
